texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Installing Jenkins on Fedora 20 is quite easy thanks to the  available Red Hat packages , but I ran into problems when I tried to start Jenkins. Here are the installation steps I followed:
texts.text: Installing Jenkins on Fedora 20 is quite easy thanks to the  available Red Hat packages , but I ran into problems when I tried to start Jenkins. Here are the installation steps I followed:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
wget -O /etc/yum.repos.d/jenkins.repo http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins.repo
rpm --import http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins-ci.org.key
yum -y install jenkins
systemctl enable jenkins
systemctl start jenkins
texts.text:
wget -O /etc/yum.repos.d/jenkins.repo http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins.repo
rpm --import http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins-ci.org.key
yum -y install jenkins
systemctl enable jenkins
systemctl start jenkins

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Your first error will show up if Java isn't installed. You can fix that by installing Java:
texts.text: Your first error will show up if Java isn't installed. You can fix that by installing Java:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: yum -y install java-1.7.0-openjdk-headless
texts.text: yum -y install java-1.7.0-openjdk-headless

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After installing Java, Jenkins still refused to start. Nothing showed up in the command line or via
texts.text: After installing Java, Jenkins still refused to start. Nothing showed up in the command line or via

texts.label: code
texts.orig: journalctl -xn
texts.text: journalctl -xn

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , so I jumped into the Jenkins log file (found at
texts.text: , so I jumped into the Jenkins log file (found at

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /var/log/jenkins/jenkins.log
texts.text: /var/log/jenkins/jenkins.log

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
Aug 13, 2014 2:21:44 PM org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.JavaUtilLog info
INFO: jetty-8.y.z-SNAPSHOT
Aug 13, 2014 2:21:46 PM org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.JavaUtilLog info
INFO: NO JSP Support for , did not find org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet
texts.text:
Aug 13, 2014 2:21:44 PM org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.JavaUtilLog info
INFO: jetty-8.y.z-SNAPSHOT
Aug 13, 2014 2:21:46 PM org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.JavaUtilLog info
INFO: NO JSP Support for , did not find org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My Java knowledge is relatively limited, so I tossed the JSP error message into Google. A  stackoverflow  thread was the first result and it talked about a possible misconfiguration with Jetty. I tried their trick of using the OPTIONS environment variable, but that didn't work.
texts.text: My Java knowledge is relatively limited, so I tossed the JSP error message into Google. A  stackoverflow  thread was the first result and it talked about a possible misconfiguration with Jetty. I tried their trick of using the OPTIONS environment variable, but that didn't work.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Then I realized that there wasn't a Jetty package installed on my server. Ouch. The installation continues:
texts.text: Then I realized that there wasn't a Jetty package installed on my server. Ouch. The installation continues:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: yum -y install jetty-jsp
texts.text: yum -y install jetty-jsp

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Jenkins could now get off the ground and I saw the familiar log messages that I'm more accustomed to seeing:
texts.text: Jenkins could now get off the ground and I saw the familiar log messages that I'm more accustomed to seeing:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
Aug 13, 2014 2:24:26 PM hudson.WebAppMain$3 run
INFO: Jenkins is fully up and running
texts.text:
Aug 13, 2014 2:24:26 PM hudson.WebAppMain$3 run
INFO: Jenkins is fully up and running

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Much of these problems could stem from the fact that Jenkins RPM's are built to suit a wide array of system versions and the dependencies aren't configured correctly. My hope is that the  Jenkins project for Fedora 21  will alleviate some of these problems and give the user a better experience.
texts.text: Much of these problems could stem from the fact that Jenkins RPM's are built to suit a wide array of system versions and the dependencies aren't configured correctly. My hope is that the  Jenkins project for Fedora 21  will alleviate some of these problems and give the user a better experience.
